You used to design buildings and understand building materials.
During your off time you liked to read architecture now.
You grew up fixing cars and did that before the outbreak.
When your car broke down you liked to fix it yourself.
You owned a small business making custom blades and iron products.
You took several classes on how to make your own iron tools
You have street smarts and know how to get things you need.
For a thrill you used to practice in the 5 fingered discount.
You are skilled in the art of making things from wood.
You built a shed or two before the outbreak
You are educated as a chemist and had just started when the outbreak began.
You spent a lot of time playing with those science kits for kids
You learned how to cook meals and worked at a local resturant.
Instead of microwaved food, you liked to cook your meals
You learned how to make circuits and work with electricity.
You fixed a few broken electrical items. Nothing too complex.
You are a 3rd generation farmer.
You had a little garden before the outbreak.
So much to learn and so little time. Its hard to focus on one thing.
You taught Martial Arts at a local community center.
You started taking a Martial Arts class at the local community center.
You worked at a machine shop and often made your own parts.
You loved spare parts and once was able to fix something with them.
As a Police Officer you were ready for the outbreak.
You often would go on ride alongs and listen to the police band.
You wrote software and feel lucky to be alive. What to do now?
You liked to make macros in excel.
You were a solder before the outbreak.
You played Soldier on the weekends with paintball guns.
You used to be a tailor making custom clothes.
You made all of your own halloween costumes.
You have gained knowledge in Chemistry ({cvar(.Chemistry_addResearchT3:0)})
You have gained knowledge in Carpentry ({cvar(.Carpentry_addResearchT3:0)})
You have gained knowledge in Tailoring ({cvar(.Tailoring_addResearchT3:0)}) and Leatherworking ({cvar(.Leatherworking_addResearchT3:0)})
